Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Paul Middleditch'], 'Producers': ['Jimmy Miller', 'David Householter', 'Ed Solomon'], 'Starring': ['Craig Robinson', 'Anna Kendrick', 'John Francis Daley'], 'Studio': ['FILM ARCADE', 'THE']}
Review Text: I will occasionally watch these spoof movies in order to see the perspectives of others even though they are supposed to be comedies. The fact of the matter is this movie attempts to not only define but reinforce some ideology of Tim Lahaye and the rest of so-called pre-trib preachers. This is a sick movie with a lot of lame comedy. Its just sad how Craig Robinson stepped into that role. I guess he just became a nothing actor after The Office. Even so, I can't imagine the indignation that Craig, Anna, and the rest of the actors will face on that day when it actually culminates. Everything in the movie has no basis in the truth if scripture. Everything is twisted and turned inside out. What a disaster and disgrace this movie is and whats even more sad is that folks find this entertaining. What vile trash.
Review Title: Horrible Spoof on a real event
Rating: 1.0
--------------------------------------------------

Review Text: John Cusack is the lead in this and his bad acting shows. He plays the Bill Gates of the pharmaceutical industry and cant convincingly pull it off. The other actors do their best to carry the show. Some more fodder for TEOTWAWKI!
Review Title: John Cusack sucks in this
Rating: 1.0

raw_response:
**Summary of Preferences and Patterns:**

- **Content Preferences**: Strong inclination towards genres featuring **violence**, **sexual content**, and **humor**. Favors narratives with **dramatic elements**.
  
- **Rating Trends**: High ratings for shows/movies featuring **consistent humor** or extremely popular, classic titles. **Highly critical** of productions where performances or narratives do not meet expectations.

- **Engagement with Content**: Shows a tendency to rewatch or revisit **beloved classics**. Expresses enthusiasm for entertainment with **strong character development**.

- **Language Preferences**: Generally prefers **English audio** with **subtitles** in various languages, indicating a desire for clarity and accessibility.

- **Mixed Reactions**: Exhibits a **polarized response** to titles; while some productions receive five-star reviews, others are criticized severely, highlighting a discerning taste.

- **Behavior Patterns**: Often reviews immediately after viewing. Engages with content through **shared experience** (e.g., “love this show,” “classic movie”) but can express intense disappointment when expectations are not met.

- **Humor and Light-heartedness**: Positive reactions to **comedy** indicate a value placed on entertainment that elicits laughter, contrasting with lower ratings for serious or poorly executed narratives. 

- **Critical View**: Insights reveal an analytical and sometimes cynical perspective on content, especially regarding production quality and character authenticity. 

Overall, this individual favors high-quality, engaging storytelling with a comedic touch, while remaining critical of subpar performances and narratives.

target_interaction.title: Seems to start off ok then quickly declines into a politically induced surrealism
target_interaction.text: Seems odd how all the best and smartest in this movie are of a particular ilk and the others that invented everything are made to look dumb..pfft more political pandering
